question: Which one of the following is not true regarding the trends during and after the Seventh Five-Year Plan process in India?
option1: During this period, gross domestic product (GNP) grew at an average rate of 5.6 per cent per year
option2: Food grain production grew by 3.23 per cent
option3: To reduce unemployment and consequently the incidence of poverty, special programmes like Jawahar Rojgar Yojana was initiated
option4: Major objectives of the plan were to achieve self-reliance and adopt measures for raising consumption standard of people living below the poverty line
answer: Major objectives of the plan were to achieve self-reliance and adopt measures for raising consumption standard of people living below the poverty line
explanation: The main objectives of the Seventh Five-Year Plan were to establish growth in areas of increasing economic productivity, production of food grains, and generating employment through \"Social Justice\".
